snippet: Despite a major effort by the Obama administration to reduce the use of antibiotics, the amount of those drugs sold for use in animals grown for food rose again last year.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration reports that sales of antibiotics sold for use in animals grown for food rose by 3 percent from 2013 and by 23 percent since 2009, despite major campaign increase by Obama administration to discourage practice.
lead_paragraph: Despite a major effort by the Obama administration to reduce the use of antibiotics, the amount of those drugs sold for use in animals grown for food rose again last year.
